fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24777].
  {panel}

It is difficult to use the manage watches page because the Watch / Don't Watch control is so far away from the associated page (the former is right aligned and the latter is left aligned). The user has to painstainkingly drag the mouse or their eyes across the line to see which element lines up with what.

This could easily be avoided using some on hover highlighting to better display what row is associated with what page and watch / don't watch control.

Or, could push the control to the left most on the page and have the page titles following them but this might upset the balance of the page

!2012-03-01_0911_plsHighlightTheRow.png!
fields.summary: Highlight the rows on "Mange Watches" page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24765].
  {panel}

Comments are handled differently in JIRA and Confluence.  When using these two tools hand-in-hand, the differences create dissonance for the users.

Examples:
Comments in JIRA can be shrunk to a single 'title' line, though this must be done on each individual comment and is not remembered across views of the page.
Comments in CONFLUENCE cannot be shrunk.

Comments in CONFLUENCE can be nested and 'replied to' (allowing a clear understanding of what a comment to a comment is referencing).
Comments in JIRA cannot be nested or replied to (there is a single stream of comments) making it difficult to refer back to a previous comment.


-=-=-

The best of both worlds would permit shrinking of comments and nesting in both tools.
fields.summary: Comments not handled the same way between JIRA and CONFLUENCE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24761].
  {panel}

As with all Wikis, they become stale. At least to me, the only way to know if a page is relevant is to know the last time a page is accessed.

So tracking the last time a page was accessed wold be a great help.
This new information needs to be available through the API.

So programmatically, we can create a report to review any page that has not been looked at in 6 months, we can decide of the page should be removed or not.

I know the workaround id for me to create a DB and harvest the data from the apache logs. But it would be nicer if you guys did this for me.

Last updated/edited is not a good way to know if a page is stale. It just might be that the page was well written, is still relevant and has not needed an update. But a page that has not been updated or looked at in a year, should be reviews and possibly deleted or updated or linked from another page.
fields.summary: Track access times for pages
Issue link demonstration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24753].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page
# Edit the page and insert a link e.g. http://localhost/asdsadsad/asdsadsa'asdsad'asdsad
# Linking does not work when the link contains single quote or curly braces

As referred here: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt
{quote}
  Usually a URL has the same interpretation when an octet is
   represented by a character and when it encoded. However, this is not
   true for reserved characters: encoding a character reserved for a
   particular scheme may change the semantics of a URL.

   Thus, only alphanumerics, the special characters "$-_.+!*'(),", and
   reserved characters used for their reserved purposes may be used
   unencoded within a URL.
{quote}

h5. Workaround:

Normally Tinny URLs don't have quote or any other special characters. Hence, you can use them instead of full link. If your current links are referring to other Confluence's page you can use Confluence Tinny URL from [Confluence Page Information|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/view-page-information-139408.html].
fields.summary: Insert Link Containing Single Quote or Curly Braces Doesn't Work
Change comment when comparing two revisions is of the latest revision

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24747].
  {panel}

Customer reports that it cannot embed videos on Confluence pages, even attach them into the space page and using Multimedia Macro Gadget.

Tried to embed the files, according to [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Embedding+Multimedia+Content], it's possible to play media that has been attached into page.

I couldn't make it work at all. Tried to play the following video formats:

* Video .mov - codec: H264 - MPEG-4 - resolution 1280x800, frame rate 8
* Video .mov - codec: MPEG-4 (mp4v) - resolution 320x240, frame rate 19
* Video .mp4 - codec: H264 - MPEG-4 - resolution 1248x592, frame rate 10
* Video .avi - codec: MPEG-4 (XVID) - resolution 240x150, frame rate 15

Embedded them into spaces according [Documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Embedding+Multimedia+Content], but without success. Tried the following: 

* Firefox 10 + Ubuntu 11.10
* Chrome 17 + Ubuntu 11.10
* Chrome 17 + Windows 7
* Firefox 10 + Windows 7
* Chrome 17 + OS X Snow Leopard
* Safari + OS X Snow Leopard

I experienced "missing plugins" in browsers running under Ubuntu and Windows. Under Firefox running Win7, it asked to download plugin due to security sets in browser. In OS X it worked without "missing plugin" issue, however videos were too large (1280x800) and taken too long to load. When finally loaded it played cropped. Some instances had 10 videos in the same space page. 

Tested with very small videos (240x150 and 320x240) and two embedded media per space page and also doesn't worked.

According [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] the browsers were supposed to work.

Thank you,
Fabiana
fields.summary: Embedded videos on Confluence doesn't load

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24728].
  {panel}

(Sorry, I couldn't find the project for the Atlassian Plugin SDK, so I've just used Confluence, please move according.)

When reading the altas-* scripts of the SDK I realised that they support an ATLAS_OPTS variable to add/modify the default MAVEN_OPTS, however by running maven in a new Bourne Shell (sh) these aren't passed successfully.

I'm not too sure what the best way to solve this, I've seen that most executable scripts (ant, mvn) tend to use either exec or eval instead of "sh -c".

Temporarily, as I'm unsure, I've simply added the single MAVEN_OPTS to inside the sh command, thus:
Replacing:
sh -c "${MAVEN_EXECUTABLE} ${MVN_PARAMS}"
with:
sh -c "MAVEN_OPTS=\"$MAVEN_OPTS\" ${MAVEN_EXECUTABLE} ${MVN_PARAMS}"
fields.summary: Unable to (successfully) pass maven options (MVN_OPTS) to atlas-* scripts of the plugin SDK

When using the WYSIWYG editor and your working on a document which gets larger then your browser window, the last line is the last visible space of your document.

I find it unpleasant to work with content that for down on the page, especially if I want to write larger porition. I'd like to scroll that area further up when I continue writing.

This is a freature request to provide more visible space below the document so the last line of the document not necessarily has to be at the bottom of the page.

I'll provide screenshot demonstrating what I mean.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24715].
  {panel}

As a tech writer interested in having some control over layout of content in Confluence, I want the TOC macro to display my headings in a table the way I want them displayed.

Currently, the TOC macro only reads headings in table cells with row priority.
There should be an option to do this with column priority.
This would then match with the behaviour with columns i.e. show the headings from col 1, then col 2...

See attached screenshot:
Under 'Using automatic merging', the first 6 items are from a table. The second set of 6 items are from 2 columns. The content is identical in both cases.
fields.summary: TOC macro should offer option to order headings in table cells by column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24684].
  {panel}

Heap sizes for Confluence are set in the system-appropriate SETENV file.
While it makes sense for Confluence to use the specified heap size when starting a new Confluence instance, the shutdown script also uses the minimum heap size.

In case where the minimum heap size is quite large (>50% of physical memory), the shutdown script will be unable to allocate memory when it tries to start. The solution is to have the shutdown script use a fixed minimum necessary amount of heap.
This would prevent users from having to reduce the heap size in setenv temporarily just to run the shutdown script, then reinstate the original heap size when starting Confluence up again.
fields.summary: Confluence should used fixed heap sizes for shutdown scripts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24666].
  {panel}

In the old wiki markup editor, it was easy to insert text using all the colours of the rainbow! (using the \{color} macro).

These days, users are restricted to only being able to easily use colours that are available in the colour picker in the editor toolbar. If you want to use a different colour, you have to use the insert wiki markup dialog.

It would be great if there was a way to easily select other colours.  This could be accomplished, for example, by allowing a user or administrator to customise the colours that appear in the picker, or adding an option to the picker that allows an arbitrary colour choice to be typed in.

This was raised by a customer on answers.atlassian.com: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/35516/how-do-i-revert-to-the-default-text-color-in-the-confluence-4-x-editor]
fields.summary: It is no longer possible to easily insert text of an arbitrary colour in the new Confluence 4 editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24665].
  {panel}
As a Confluence user, I would like to be able to insert links with custom url protocols. 
The new editor does not properly create links that do not use one of the standard web protocols when inserting with the Insert Link dialog (e.g. http://, ftp://).  It creates the <a> but without a href attribute.  In 3.5 and earlier, you could create a link for any protocol type using wiki markup: \[something://mysite.com\].  Inserting the wiki markup results in the link being stripped and the URI appearing as plaintext.

The only workaround is to insert a link manually with the HTML macro, but not all sites will be able to enable this macro for security reasons.

h3. Why is this important
Companies may rely on links for specific tools used by their departments and the ability to link those does impact productivity and ease of use of the platforms
fields.summary: Add ability to create links using non-standard protocols
Authentication from an AD

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24656].
  {panel}

As a confluence user, I would like to subscribe to changes for a given set of topics (=words).

If you take a look at "Google Alerts" you will understand what is meant here.

I do not want to watch certain spaces or pages (that I have to be aware of). I just want to be alerted if somewhere new content shows up with the topics I'm interested in.

I can imagine, that users can build this functionality with RSS feeds and tools and filters, but this is too complicated for many users. It needs to become a native Confluence feature - easy and intuitive for everybody.

In my eyes this is a key feature many users will appreciate.
fields.summary: Provide Feature "Confluence Alert" analogue to "Google Alert"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24651].
  {panel}

Look at introducing a power user mode for the Confluence RTE. This is to avoid the need to edit the raw storage format via the source editor.

This could include features such as:

* Showing (and possibly editing) various markup indicators
  ** Markup
  ** Meta data, such as macro parameters, link and image URLs/locations
  ** Scope of items such as list items, paragraphs, etc.
* Ability to search and replace meta data (macro parameters, link and image URLs/locations).
* Reducing visual clutter (e.g. render images as small placeholders rather than full size images).
* Inline track-changes - show changes as they're made.

The [Confluence Wiki Markup Styler plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/606145] covers some of this functionality, though has some limitations and some browser specific issues with cursor positioning and movement (really browser bugs that would need working around).
fields.summary: Power User Mode of the Confluence Editor
Error message from auto save needs to discourage users from hitting save

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24646].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce the problem:

1) Create a space named SpaceA
2) Create a page within SpaceA called PageA
3) Attach an image to PageA named ImageA.png
4) On PageA, add a gallery macro containing ImageA.png
5) Export PageA and verify that the full page along with the image were exported with the image available by clicking on the thumbnail
6) Create a space named SpaceB
7) Create a page within SpaceB called PageB
8) On PageB, add a gallery macro for ImageA.png using the syntax: {gallery:include=ImageA.png|page=SpaceA:PageA}
9) Export PageB and notice that the image has not been exported. When the export has been opened in a webbrowser, the thumbnail for ImageA is visible, but cannot be clicked to view the full size.

So, in a nutshell, if you are using a gallery macro that includes an image attachment from other space, I think the correct is to export this image together when exporting the original space where the gallery macro resides.
fields.summary: Exporting an Space to HTML doesn't includes attachments from gallery macros included from other spaces
Export page history in PDF and Word exports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24629].
  {panel}

plugins search breaks after searching and then switching tabs

steps to reproduce:
1) go to confluence admin -> plugins
2) open system plugins
3) search for something, eg "apache"
4) click on another tab, eg the "Upgrade" tab
5) let the page load, then move back to the "Manage Existing"

notice how the list of plugins has refreshed, displaying all plugins, yet the search bar still contains "apache". the search is now broken, the only thing that you can do now is enter nonsense, eg "asdasdasd" and it will show you the "No plugins in this category match your filter." message
fields.summary: plugin search breaks when switching to another tab after performing a search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24620].
  {panel}

The enclosed website / page has 3500 anchors. Our nationwide website has about 60 named links that point to respective anchors on the FR webpage. When we link to a specific anchor on the webpage, the correct anchor comes up on the display correctly, but then as the page continues to load, the correct anchor will rise or lower from view, on the display.

What we need:
# To have the link stop at the correct anchor, with the anchor at the top of the display.
# The current macro / link accepts input for the specific anchor, with the qualifier  "#p-537".

*We need the capability to display data between "From anchor","To anchor"*

When a client clicks a named link, we want the client to see only data relevant to the link name, not have to review the other 3500 anchors of data to see where his search should end.

Details:

# We link to the following web site and anchor:
http://www.federalregister.gov/articles/2010/07/28/2010-17207/medicare-and-medicaid-programs-electronic-health-record-incentive-program#p-537

# This particular link / anchor on the webpage is named:
NPRM EP/Eligible Hospital Objective: Maintain active medication allergy list
The anchor number is 537
On our web page, the link is named: Maintain Active Medication Allergy List

# As my test link, in the Rich Text editor, and on our Confluence page we see: [EvaluationLink|https://www.federalregister.gov/articles/2010/07/28/2010-17207/medicare-and-medicaid-programs-electronic-health-record-incentive-program#p-514]

# In the Wikieditor for our Confluence page, we see the link as:
 [EvaluationLink|http://www.federalregister.gov/articles/2010/07/28/2010-17207/medicare-and-medicaid-programs-electronic-health-record-incentive-program#p-537 ]

# When we click on the link:
The link goes directly to the webpage, and to the correct anchor which will be at the top of the display / screen.
But the rest of the web page is still downloading to our computer, as one can see by the messages in the lower left hand corner.
The correct anchor moves up and down several pages, while the whole page is loading

# Anchor 537 on the webpage is:
 NPRM EP/Eligible Hospital Objective: Maintain active medication allergy list
## For this particular link, we want to display the data between only anchors 537 to 559, and not download the whole page to the client, or us.

# There are about 3500 anchors on the page, we would prefer our nationwide clients, who may have limited broadband capability, not have to download the whole page, then have to search for their requested item.

# The expected updated macro would look something like this:
http://www.federalregister.gov/articles/2010/07/28/2010-17207/medicare-and-medicaid-programs-electronic-health-record-incentive-program#p-537 to #p-559
fields.summary: Provide capability to display data between "From anchor" and "To anchor"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24588].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

When I was creating or modifying templates before 4.0,  I used to create a page which looked the template I wanted to create, "view page in Wiki markup" and copy pasted the wiki markup text in the template editor. Few minor manuall corrections later I had the template I wanted.

Now the "view in Wiki markup"-option is gone, whilst templates still must be written in wiki markup. 

My questions: 

a) is the a way to see a page in wiki markup?

b) do you know any other workaround to solve this?

c) are you allready planning to fix the template editor, so that wiki markup is no longer neccessary?

Thank you very much in advance!

Best, 

Viktor 

PS: Several other users seen to have the same problem. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+a+template?focusedCommentId=275188366#comment-275188366
fields.summary: Editing templates in v4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24583].
  {panel}

* Work on a draft and have it saved by confluence (BTW why there is no obvious 'Save as draft' button?? I would love to be able to choose when to save a draft and not wait for some auto magic to do it for me...)
* once auto-saved it will be in your drafts
* go to the same space and try to add another blog post. You will get notification that there is already one draft and whether you'd like to resume editing it
* hit cancel on that page and you lose the draft you had before

Suggested improvement:
* once a draft is saved and has a name, the user should never be able to delete it, except explicitly via the 'Drafts' page or any link that actually says it will delete the link. The 'cancel' button from the example above does not count as such
* users should be able to create multiple drafts in one space as long as they're given an unique name
fields.summary: Prevent users from losing hours of work on their blogs...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24577].
  {panel}

We have JIRA integrated with Confluence. With that we can insert JIRA issues into Confluence and see some of the fields associated with the issue in Confluence as well. One thing we still can't see is SVN log associated with the JIRA issue. It'll make the integration even more helpful if this information can be displayed as well.

Creating on behalf of vivian.zhang@huawei.com in relation to support tickets 
[CSP-76058|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-76058]
[CSP-75976|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-75976]
fields.summary: Insert SVN log associated with JIRA issue in Confluence
Server Base Url not correct in developement mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24570].
  {panel}

In jira you have only 3 levels to model your project system.
So for our business projects we used:
 jira projects to model programs, 
 issues for projects 
 and sub-tasks for project tasks like business requirements

The ability to create jira sub-tasks in confluence would be very usefull,specially for large projects, since we create requirements documentation in confluence and we could create the requirements fastly in jira as well without leaving confluence.
Thank you
fields.summary: Ability to create jira sub-tasks in confluence
Conditional display of Macro in Macrobrowser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24566].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce
See [video|http://screencast.com/t/7T37JIMt]

The order is important. The following steps will produce different behaviour
# Type out heading
# Type out link text
# Linkify text
# Undo
This will delete the link and the link alias only

h5. QA Notes

h5. Reproduced Using
Chrome
IE9
fields.summary: Undoing a link will delete either a preceding heading or a the link itself depending on order of content creation
Allow users to sort or re-order favourite pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24563].
  {panel}

Dragging and dropping of anything within the editor is impossible.

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page two images.
# Drag the first image after/below the second image
# The image remains where it was:
#* Expected behaviour: It should be where it was dropped. 

This example is with images, but this also happens with macro placeholders and text. (CONF-23454 mentions text, so should probably a sub issue of this).
fields.summary: Cannot drag and drop within the new editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24558].
  {panel}

I just hit this issue a few mins ago: 

# Need to delete a page on the integration space
# Realised I don't have access
# So I need to contact space admin... so I ask Shihab, thinking he is space admin .. and he isn't... so I ask around - a few people don't know who is...
# My solution: Have to talk to IT and ask them to tell me who is admin, then I sort my problem out.

Customers have solved this manually by:

# Creating a page that actas like a "space directory"
# For every space, they manually use the User List Macro to render all the users in the respective space-admin group.

Goal: Make it easy to discover who the space admins are for a space

This is the exact same model as the JIRA project listing - you can see who the admin is (And contact them manually) if you have an issue. To do this, we should:

*  Add a "Space Administrator(s)" column to the space directory that lists the names of users (we can set a hard-limit to the number and do a ... if there are heaps.
* In Browse > Advanced also add the space admins here with the other space metadata.
fields.summary: Make space admins discoverable to a user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24552].
  {panel}

When I am adding labels to a page, I often get this after I submit them:

You tried to add 21 labels. You can only add 20 labels at a time.

That's fine, I guess, but then it doesn't give me a chance to go back and edit my list.  I have to start from scratch, which is very annoying.

I suggest you #1.) allow adding unlimited labels, or #2.) if that's not possible, maybe an increase to that seemingly-arbitrary limit, and #3.) and probably most-important, allow me to go back and edit the list of labels that I just typed in in order to make it shorter.
fields.summary: Label Limit of 20?  Why Can't I Go Back?
Autoconvert openphoto.me URLs image urls into embedded images.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24550].
  {panel}

On instances with a number of spaces above a certain threshold you can only create a blog post (from the dashboard gadget) in a space from your favourites. There should be an easy way to create posts in arbitrary spaces.

Two suggestions I have are:
* Frotherise the select menu
* Add a link to a page which lists all spaces you have edit permissions in and allows you to create a space from there.

I should mention that I'm quite familiar with Confluence and it took me a while to figure out I had to first navigate to the desired space before creating the post. People less familiar will have even more trouble.
fields.summary: No easy way to create a blog post in an arbitrary space from the dashboard
Please show title change history when viewing page history

{code}
fields.summary: When creating a page, if the spaces dropdown has not loaded clicking 'next' gives a stack trace
Unable to delete tasklist items. Can only delete them from wiki markup editor. using conf 3.5.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24540].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of The Bug

When page title have any character after a colon( : )

{code}
Office Connector:test
{code}

office connector can't find the office files attached to the page. If colon is the last character on the page title, attached office files searchable by view office macro

h3. How to reproduce the bug

# Create a page (example: 'Office connector:')
!Officepage.png|thumbnail!
# Attached office file into the page
!attached.png|thumbnail!
# Try to view it using view office plugin
!Works.png|thumbnail!
# Change the page title to contain any character after colon (example: 'Office connector:test')
!test.png|thumbnail!
# Try to view it using view office plugin
!broke.png|thumbnail!
# Attached files can't be seen on "File Name" fields
(i) When viewed with _Developer Tools_, the {{attachmentsearch.action}} GET request returned HTTP 404 error code.

h3. Workarounds
Option 1 - Rename the page to remove the ':'

Option 2 - Use the insert markup feature:
# From the editor toolbar, expand the '+' menu.
# Choose 'Markup'.
# Insert the following markup (change accordingly):
{code}
{view file:name_of_the_attachments.ext}
{code}
# Save

h1. Work performed
* Changes are backwards-compatible in the plugin, committed in https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/officeconnector issue/CONF-24540 . 2 backwards-compatibility issues were raised: CONFDEV-10156 and CONFDEV-10157.
* Changes in confluence-core are still on issue/CONF-24540, and awaiting implementation of a few review comments before being committed.
fields.summary: Viewfile macro can't find attachment if the page title contain character after colon (:)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24536].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
(You will need to do the page creation steps in a non-IE8 browser if CONFDEV-6815 is not yet fixed)
* Create a page, add in a two-column layout. 
* In the first column, type some text and add in an image and table.
* Save the page

(Now you can switch to IE8)
* Position the cursor at the top of the page layout cell, and hit tab.
You will see the image get selected and then then the table. As you try to tab past the table in IE8, a JS error will be thrown.

The tab key should not select elements, it should move the cursor to the next cell.
fields.summary: IE8 only - Trying to tab into a table generates an exception
Long words fail to wrap in PDF export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24530].
  {panel}

When using Safari 5.1.1/5.1.2 (could be more versions but these are the ones I was able to check) and viewing a page in Confluence which has embedded flash, an error is displayed stating 'missing plug-in'

*To Replicate*
* Open Safari 5.1.1/5.1.2
* Navigate [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Embedding+Multimedia+Content]
* Observe error where embedded flash object should be.
fields.summary: Safari 5.1.1/5.1.2 will not load embedded flash
Selection Circles Not Displaying Correctly on Add Page from Template Screen
Documentation theme: Add a new field to allow custom content to be added underneath the default page tree
Page.getDescendents() should use a ListBuilder
